thread.title: UNH roundup: Preseason honors for Leissner, Smith
thread.title_full: UNH roundup: Preseason honors for Leissner, Smith

author: Special to the Herald
title: UNH roundup: Preseason honors for Leissner, Smith
text: UNH roundup: Preseason honors for Leissner, Smith Comment By Special to the Herald seacoastonline.com By Special to the Herald Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 10:56 PM Updated at 10:57 PM By Special to the Herald Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 10:56 PM Updated at 10:57 PM » Social News DURHAM — Sophomore Tanner Leissner and junior Jaleen Smith of the University of New Hampshire men’s basketball team have been named to the College Sports Madness Preseason America East All-Conference second team. The Wildcats have a total of four student-athletes who received recognition. Junior Daniel Dion was named to the All-Conference third team and classmate Jacoby Armstrong was placed on the All-Conference fourth team. Leissner, the reigning America East Rookie of the Year, led UNH in points per game (12.8), rebounds per game (7.8) and blocks (19). After the season, he was named to the America East All-Conference second team and the All-Rookie team. Smith ranked second in points at 10.7 per game, led the Wildcats with 2.8 assists per game and recorded the highest free throw percentage on the squad, 80.5. On the defensive end, he notched 43 steals to pace the team and ranked second in rebounds at 5.2 a game. The Wildcats, who tied a program record last year with 19 wins, open their new season Nov. 13 at home against Lyndon (Vt.) State. Crossan honored RICHMOND, Va. — Dalton Crossan, a junior running back on the 20th-ranked UNH football team, was named the CAA Football co-Offensive Player of the Week on Monday. Crossan recorded career highs in rushes (22), rushing yards (140) and touchdowns (four) to lead the Wildcats to a 37-14 victory against Elon on Saturday. He averaged 6.4 yards per carry and eclipsed 100 yards for the first time as a Wildcat as part of 177 all-purpose yards. Crossan scored four first-half rushing touchdowns to propel the Wildcats to a 34-0 lead. His 36-yard scamper opened the game scoring just 75 seconds into the game. Soccer nets awards BOSTON — Junior co-captain Chris Wingate and freshman Chris Arling of the UNH men’s soccer team each earned an America East weekly award Monday. Wingate was named the Player of the Week while Arling took home the Rookie of the Week honor. The Wildcats earned their seventh win of the season and improved to 7-0-2 after a 3-1 win in their first conference game of the year against UMass-Lowell on Saturday. Wingate tallied a career-high three points on a goal and an assist in the match. He now has 10 points on four goals and two assists. Arling assisted on Wingate’s game-winning goal and had a game high six shots. He now has six points on the year from one goal and four assists. Murphy earns honor BOSTON – Sophomore Brooke Murphy of the UNH women's soccer team has been named Co-Player of the Week by the America East conference, following a goal and an assist this past weekend. Monday's announcement follows a weekend where the 'Cats defeated Vermont, 3-2, and Albany, 1-0, to remain unbeaten in conference play. Murphy leads the team with seven goals this season and 18 in her career. She ranks ninth in program history with her career goals total. Volleyball duo cited BOSTON — Senior defensive specialist Madison Lightfoot and junior middle blocker Demi Muses of the UNH volleyball team were named the Defensive Specialist and Player of the Week, respectively, by the America East on Monday. The duo propelled the Wildcats to a pair of straight set victories on the road over Albany (25-22, 25-20, 25-21) and Binghamton (25-18, 25-23, 25-22). Lightfoot, a senior co-captain, averaged 5.50 digs per set in the two wins. Muses, a junior, registered a pair of double-double performances on the week. By Special to the Herald seacoastonline.com By Special to the Herald Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 10:56 PM Updated at 10:57 PM
